document_data.name: Ha-yoon Kim
document_data.mainbody:
'''Ha-yoon Kim''' was a [[human]] commoner from the [[Baldur's Gate/Rivington|Rivington]] district of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
{{quote|''Would everyone please stop going on about the "Absolute's army?" Lord Gortash is going to sort it all out, you'll see.''|Ha-yoon Kim}}
document_data.Description: Ha-yoon's name and appearance suggested a [[Kara-Tur]]an descent. She hid her hair under a maroon coif and wore a [[corset]], with a simple white ribbon for decoration around her neck.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, the army assembled by the [[Cult of the Absolute]] moved from the [[Moonrise Towers]] in the [[Chionthar Valley]] to menace the city of Baldur's Gate, displacing countless refugees along the way. Pressured by the refugee crisis, Baldur's Gate closed the [[Wyrm's Crossing]] bridge, separating Rivington from other parts of the metropolis and turning it into a refugee tent city. Unlike many other inhabitants of Rivington, Ha-yoon Kim thought the looming threat of [[the Absolute]] to be nothing to worry about. She placed her trust in Lord [[Enver Gortash]] and his capability and desire to protect the Baldurians.
